meanings.sent1: The blacksmith sulfurized the iron to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The scientist sulfurized the compound to study its properties.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally sulfurized the soup, giving it an unexpected tangy flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist sulfurized the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a striking masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener sulfurized the soil, making the plants grow healthier and greener.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction with sulfur.
meanings.sent1: The metal pipe sulfurized when exposed to sulfuric fumes.
meanings.sent2: The organic matter sulfurized in the presence of sulfur bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot sulfurized after being left in the sulfur pit too long.
meanings.sent4: The old book sulfurized over time, giving it a distinct smell.
meanings.sent5: The fabric sulfurized upon contact with the sulfur compound, changing its color.
